text: I really liked the noodle dishes at Rice Avenue compared to their Green Curry dish .
We a menu that rearely changes , e xcept for one or two specials , the quality and care they put in thier food in evident .
Aside from the Sea Urchin , the chef recommended an assortment of fish including Fatty Yellow Tail , Boton Shrimp , Blue Fin Torro ( Fatty Tuna ) , Sea Eel , etc. .
The table next to us asked if he crushed the grapes himself when their long overdue bottle of wine finally arrived .
Dessert - ca n't be missed , so save room !!!
However , I was there for a work dinner not long ago when my colleague from London noticed a very large waterbug on the ceiling .
However , in the summer of 2003 , it seems the management has changed and the great big door has been replaced for a glass front ridding itself of the dark romantic getup .
It is kinda nosiy and the tables are close together but it 's still a beautiful place to enjoy a nice dinner .
While the new restaurant still features much of the same classical furniture that made Tiffin so attractive , the menu has been overhauled .
Fluke sashimi drizzled with jalapeno-lime olive oil , the fruit of the oil nicely highlighting the fish 's sweetness .
All my co-workers were amazed at how small the dish was .
The Singapore Mai Fun had NO curry flavor whatsoever .
And it all comes at a very reasonable price ( congee , noodles , and rice dishes are no more than $ 3-6 each ) .
Great friendly service , Fast seating , Fast Delivery , Excellent sushi .
